metadata.title: CVE-2021-29952 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
When Web Render components were destructed, a race condition could have caused undefined behavior, and we presume that with enough effort may have been exploitable to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 88.0.1 and Firefox for Android < 88.1.3.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-29952` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 88.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2
firefox-geckodriver - 88.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2
firefox-mozsymbols - 88.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '88.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2').
mozjs78 package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
